name: Cincinnatian Hotel

reviews.text: Heard lots of good things about this hotel and was looking forward to the trip. I was there on business. The lobby is nice, decent area of downtown, but my room was very small (only queen bed) with no outside window, just a view of the atrium. Bed was comfy but furniture and rug was dirty and dated. Room had no tub but a large two person shower that was nice but it needed some grout cleaning and some updating.
reviews.title: Needs some updating

likes.disliked: — room needed new carpet and was small

reviews.text: Would not go back unkess they do a total renovation. Would try Westin next time.
reviews.title: okay

likes.disliked: — room service pricing and cleanliness of room

reviews.title: Half and Half
reviews.text: Also did not get my wake up service.

wife had company meeting so were were booked here. Nice entry, good service upon arrival. Room was nice, spacious and mostly clean. Bar was okay. Good exerice room, especially the private video screens on each piece of aerobic equipment, nice!
reviews.title: Perfect

likes.disliked: — Hard to find, expensive room service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: $60 for 2 granola with yogurts, 2-oj's and 1/2 pot coffee for room service seemed excessive!!
reviews.title: The Weekend of my Life!

likes.liked: — The room and the food in the Palace Restaurant

reviews.text: I have traveled to Cinci at least 4 nights a month over the past 3 years and have stayed in every major hotel in the downtown and across-the-river in Kentucky during that time and have settled on the Westin as my first choice. Here are the reasons:
reviews.title: Best rooms in Cinci

reviews.text: - location -- very close to my place of business
reviews.title: Swell Service, Super Comfy, Convenient

likes.liked: — friendly service, best location for visiting Cincinnati, high quality room
likes.disliked: — if you don't like Cincinnati, this is still very Cincinnati

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - size, quality and cleanliness of the rooms -- the rooms were all updated...in 2007 I think and while it's not my favorite personal decorating style (modernistic contemporary), at least the furniture is in good shape with updated rugs, bedding and bathrooms.
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay

likes.liked: — The historic ambience of the building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Starwood frequent guest program -- the best hotel program out there and since my second choice hotel in Cinci (the Cincinnatian) is part of the Preferred Hotel group and I don't stay in many of their hotels -- I'd rather build my points with Starwood which has many, many properties in the places I hope to travel.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel for an anniversary in Cincinnati

likes.liked: — Nice clean room w/ good service

reviews.text: - Friendly helpful staff -- especially Jake, the bellman in the mornings and the bartender at their ridiculous lobby "bar." Super guys who remember you and your needs.
reviews.title: Worst customer service I've ever experienced

reviews.text: The hotel was a really pleasant place to stay during a recent business trip to Cincinnati. I've not stayed in US hotels before, so can't really run a fair comparison but, compared to all the European hotels I've stayed in, the service at the Cincinnatian was 10x better.
reviews.title: Really good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was as expected, if not slightly better. Personally I wouldn't recommend their restaurant that highly. It did a good breakfast, but the lunch I had was somewhat lacklustre.
reviews.title: Not The Best Experience

likes.liked: — Location in relation to the Taft Theatre
likes.disliked: — Mold/1980s decor/on the phone customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the price - and even if it cost 50% more - the Cincinnatian was a great stopover.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprising

likes.disliked: — Can't really think of anything I disliked? Maybe only one cookie with turndown.

reviews.text: I want to start out by saying that I made a phone call to the reservations desk after I stayed and yelled at the woman working there. I am sorry for that as she did not deserve it...I was just really upset about our stay.
reviews.title: Nice enough, but looking a bit past her prime
The best hotel in downtown Cincinnati
reviews.text: I booked a room for one night at the Cincinnatian because it was described as a "Historic Hotel" and named as one of the Historic Hotels of America. For two years I worked for a historic 4 diamond hotel but the lobby interior was original 1923 as well as many of the fixtures and antique English furnishing in the room. This hotel is only historic if you consider the mid-1980s to be history. Our room had blue plush carpet, a dark blue armchair with 80s fabric and nautical blue and white 1980s curtains, and tan striped wall paper that has seen better days. Oh, and we enjoyed looking at all of these things with the huge magnifying glass that was in the desk (strange) The tile in the bathroom was tan with white, moldy grout and it smelled like mold. Our brown toilet flushed...but barely. Even the turn down service seemed outdated as they left a little white towl on the floor next to each side of the bed. There was a floor lamp which you turned on by putting your foot behind the chair and stepping on a button, the picture frames were black lacquer and the oversized white shiny lamps screemed "Pretty in Pink".
This hotel has some great pluses and a few minuses.
reviews.title: Mixed blessings

likes.disliked: — The room temperature/hard bed/noise made for poor night's sleep.

reviews.text: *As you might expect from an old building, it is noisy - but worse, our room opened to the lobby, 8 floors down. The doors didn't close tightly enough, so we could hear the laughter from the bar until they closed.**The rooms do not have their own thermostat, and I found ours a bit too warm to sleep comfortably**The mattress was hard and that also impacted a poor night's sleep**The old TV had a non-functioning remote. We didn't spend much time in the room, so this was not all that important to us, but the front desk did apologize when I mentioned it at check-out.
reviews.title: You have to stay here!
Wonderful experience
reviews.text: *The towels and robes were plush and soft - the towels were oversized too**The staff was friendly - although the valet was hard to find and pricey, the service was fast and very friendly**The location was convenient to the ballpark and other downtown activities**

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow! The Cincinnatian may very well be the best hotel experience I've ever had. I was worried by some of the reviews, but I'm happy to report that my experience over a 5 day period proved to be relaxing, quiet and beautiful. Check in was smooth and my room had character. Hard wood floors with an oversized tub highlighted my room. Another big bonus to this place is the original art throughout and the unique sitting spaces (overstuffed leather chairs, comfy loveseats) sprinkled throughout the common spaces. The staircase goes all the way up to the eighth floor and the design details make each corner a place where interesting visuals abound. The bed was perfect and the AC kept things cool during a very hot weekend. While you're here, you must indulge in one of the best features of the Cincinnatian - the room service. The service and attention from the staff will be worth it alone. No detail is overlooked and the entire staff at the hotel will make you feel like royalty. Not so easy to find in our present day. The daily executive cheese/fruit/nut/cracker tray changed a little each day - yum!
reviews.title: Not impressed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's true the hotel may not be the most modern establishment, but it comes down to what you value: If you want to stay in a place that values beauty, character and service over all else, this is the place for you. (You'll love the piano and violin duo on the weekend evenings sipping wine in the lounge, and the mass amount of orchids and other floral arrangements too!).
reviews.title: Loved the Cincinnatian

description: Small, luxury boutique hotel built in 1882 and listed on the National Register of Historic places. Proud member of Hisotric Hotels of America and Preferred Hotels International, The Cincinnatian Hotel celebrates its 130th year this September. Boasting of a wide range of accommodations, this namesake hotel of Cincinnati is the perfect home away from home destination for those who want something simple or something grand. Call for details.
